importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article indicates the most recent update on the ongoing conflict in Gaza, showing the current timeline of events and escalation or de-escalation in the ceasefire situation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline from the start of the ceasefire to the publication date highlights the duration and ongoing violations, emphasizing the fragility of the truce and its impact on civilians.

keyTakeAways: Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the ceasefire.
Gaza Government Media Office reports that Israel has breached the truce agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday.
The UN relief coordinator visited Gaza City to inspect the devastation, indicating the humanitarian crisis and the need for international response.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation-state in the Middle East
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The article attributes violence and breaches of ceasefire to Israel, making it central to understanding the conflict dynamics and military actions in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian-controlled territory in the Middle East
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the location of the violence and civilian casualties, and the focal point of the ceasefire violations and humanitarian impact.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Government Media Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A governmental body in Gaza responsible for media communication
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides official reports on ceasefire breaches, offering a Palestinian perspective on the ongoing conflict and violations.

namedEntities.name: UN relief coordinator
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An international official from the United Nations responsible for humanitarian aid
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The UN relief coordinator's visit underscores the international community's awareness of the humanitarian crisis and the need for aid and accountability.

namedEntities.name: Sunday
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Specifies the day when 21 ceasefire violations occurred, adding temporal detail to the breach pattern.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Since the start of a ceasefire, Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza, with the Gaza Government Media Office reporting 80 ceasefire breaches, including 21 on Sunday. The UN relief coordinator visited Gaza City to assess the destruction, highlighting the severe humanitarian crisis and the ongoing instability of the truce.
title: Israel kills 97 Palestinians in Gaza since start of ceasefire
